oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Trautes Heim, dien denk' ich immer / Trautes Heim, dir gilt mein Gruss
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The translated printed portion of this German postcard reads, "Home Sweet Home, I'm always thinking of you/Home Sweet Home, you receive my regards" which are lines from the German folks song, "I Want to Return Home," written circa 1885. Written on top of the card is "Please respond immediately, your husband" and below, "Give my regards to my Children." The reverse inciates that the soldier is writing from a hospital in Saarburg. The soldier was Landsturmmann F. Heinbach, Landstrum Btn. No. 15.
